snippet: Under the revisions, signed on Monday by Gov. Chris Christie, tenure for public-school teachers in New Jersey will be harder to get, and firings will be easier to carry out.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie signs legislation overhauling the state's century-old tenure law, with the goal of making it harder for public school teachers to get tenure and easier to fire bad educators; tenure has long been among the most contentious issues for teachers' unions and legislators.
lead_paragraph: Under the revisions, signed on Monday by Gov. Chris Christie, tenure for public-school teachers in New Jersey will be harder to get, and firings will be easier to carry out.

headline.seo: Governor Chris Christie Signs Bill Overhauling Teacher Tenure in New Jersey
headline.main: Christie Signs Bill Overhauling Job Guarantees for Teachers
headline.print_headline: Christie Signs Bill Overhauling Job Guarantees for Teachers
